column1: Ust-Labinsk (Russian: Усть-Лаби́нск) is a town and the administrative center of Ust-Labinsky District of Krasnodar Krai
The town is situated in the central part of Krasnodar Krai
column2: at the confluence of the Kuban and Laba rivers
column3: 62 km to the east of Krasnodar.

column1: History of Ust-Labinsk dates back to 1778
column2: when fort Aleksandrovskiy was founded at the confluence of Kuban and Laba rivers. The construction was finished in 1793
column3: under the direction of general Ivan Gudovich.

column1: In 1794 stanitsa Ust-Labinskaya was established by the resettled Don Cossacks. On May 28
column3: it was granted town status and renamed.Two Heroes of the Soviet Union (Alexander Geraskin and Ivan Ivaschenko) were born in Ust-Labinsk
column4: as well as soviet engineer Nikolay Popov (the chief designer of the T-80 tank)
column5: and football player Anton Vlasov. The 'Pioneer Hero' Abram Pinkenson was shot by the Nazis in the town in 1942. Russian billionaire Oleg Deripaska grew up in the town.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Ust-Labinsk serves as the administrative center of Ust-Labinsky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Ust-Labinsky District as the Town of Ust-Labinsk. As a municipal division
column6: the territory of Ust-Labinsk is incorporated within Ust-Labinsky Municipal District as Ust-Labinskoye Urban Settlement. The two rural localities are incorporated separately: the settlement of Dvubratsky is incorporated as Dvubratskoye Rural Settlement
column7: while the khutor of Oktyabrsky is a part of Zheleznoye Rural Settlement

column2: А. С.; И. Ю. Бондарь; Н. С. Вертышева (1986).  Основные административно-территориальные преобразования на Кубани (1793–1985 гг.) (in Russian). Краснодарское книжное издательство.
